title: Can we please get a change to Kalista's tooltip? as it has incorrect information.

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
Kalista is a great champ, Ive been trying to learn her for some time now, but I'm still probably the worst Kalista in the OCE server. :S 

She is a hard champ already, but having conflicting information in her tooltip doesn't make her any easier for inexperienced players. 

_________

When you read the tooltip for Kalista's ultimate Fate's Call, it says that that the Oathsworn flies out, stopping at the first enemy struck and knocking back **ALL** enemies in a radius. But if you read the tooltip for the Oathsworrn buff _(black spear icon in the buffs/debuffs area)_ it says that the Oathsworn **ONLY** knocks up the first target hit.

_________

This is a huge difference, especially from the Oathsworn's perspective, _(seeming that they don't have access to the correct Fate's Call tooltip.) _
The support could read the buff tooltip and understand that they only knock up the first target hit. While Kalista knows that they knock up everyone _(unless Kalista read the wrong tooltip as well)._

That could potentially cause a major communication error when fighting, Kalista press R with the intention to knockup the whole team, but the support chooses to abort instead, because the don't want to be thrown into a 1v5 just to knock up 1 person. Then Kalista is suddenly left facing a whole team, alone.

It also calls the CC itself two very different things, the Oathsworn buff calls it a Knockup, while Fate's call calls it a knock back, _(which are two completely different things) _

And unlike champions like Yasuo/Zed/Vayne/Lucian who are in every game, and every player knows inside out. Kalista is hardly seen, and a lot of people dont know what she can do _(most of the supports in lane with me, don't even know that they can last hit minions for me)_ so it is indeed likely that people could get confused and think the wrong things. 

In any case, wether it causes a mis-communication or not, there shouldn't be conflicting information of any kind, anywhere in any tooltip. 

Can we please see a change here :) for clarity's sake.
